avalancheActivity.comment: The snowpack is mostly stable. In arid areas above the forest line, weak layers may be present in the snowpack. In a few places in the high alpine regions, a small, clustered Avalanche may be triggered under higher loads. Some creeping of dry, untracked new snow is possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The danger of Avalanche is low.

snowpackStructure.comment: Snowpack is mostly stable, with significant snowmelt on sunny slopes. On the sunny slopes, the old snow base is hard in many places. In the osoles, weak layers may be present in the Old snowpack. Up to 10 cm of new fallen snow has fallen on the old snow base, with the snowfall level around 1800 m above altitudes.

tendency.highlights: Friday will see more clarity in the mountains, with a weak to moderate westerly wind that will weaken during the day. Temperatures will be 4 °C at 1500 m and -1 °C at 2500 m.

weatherForecast.comment: Mostly cloudy and partly foggy. Light to moderate south-westerly to westerly winds. Temperatures will be around 2 °C at 1500 m and -2 °C at 2500 m.
